sentences.sContent: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.sCn: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.sContent: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.sCn: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

sentences.sContent: ...The report says America’s urbanization will continue to be the most significant issue affecting the industry...
...Another trend that looks significant in 2015 is that America’s largest population group...
...As we widely know that the relationship between parents and children plays a significant role in the domestic relationship...
...how attractive the neighborhood was—had no significant relationship to how the residents fared in terms of illness...
...It should be generally acknowledged that classic literature plays a significant role not only in preserving the essence of great minds but also in enhancing the quality of one’s life...
...Mr Jobs had become something much more significant than just a clever money-maker...
...soda taxes would result in significant weight loss: apparently people who are determined to eat — and drink — unhealthily will find ways to do it...
...one of the most significant advantages is that online shopping brings customers so much convenience that it is widely recognized as much more time-saving than traditional shopping...
...The latest “Global Report on Human Settlements” says a significant change took place last year...

exam.question: Research shows that there is no ______ relationship between how much a person earns and whether he feels good about life.

answer.explain: 句意： 研究显示， 一个人赚多少钱和他是否感到生活幸福没有很大关系。successive： 继承的； 连续的； subsequent： 后来的； sincere： 诚挚的， 真诚的。

synos.tran: 重大的；有效的；有意义的；值得注意的；意味深长的

phrases.pCn: 显著水准；检验水准；有效水平
有意味的形式；蕴意形式；言之有意的形式

remMethod.val: signif(看作signify， 有重要性) ＋ icant(…的) → 重要的

words.tran: 有意义的；表示…的；为…提供推定证据的
意味深长地；值得注目地
有重要性；要紧；冒充内行

trans.tranOther: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future
